Note on the Editors Frederik Herman has been a lecturer at the School of Education of the University of Applied Sciences and Arts Northwestern Switzerland (PH FHNW) since March 2018 and the Schwyz University of Teacher Education since
He is specializing in the social and cultural history of education. He completed his doctorate on twentieth-century school culture at the University of Leuven, Belgium in

Frederik joined the FAMOSO project at the University of Luxembourg as a postdoctoral researcher in March 2013 and was a member of the Institute of Education and Society and later of the Luxembourg Centre for Contemporary and Digital History until February 2018. His publications have dealt with topics such as school culture and materialities of schooling; psychophysiology, professional orientation, and vocational training; cultural learning, heritage making, and identity construction; and visual histories of schooling

title: Sjaak Braster is Associate Professor for Sociology at the Erasmus School of Social and Behavioural Sciences, Erasmus University of Rotterdam, The Netherlands. He was Professor of History of Education at Utrecht University from

He also was Chairman of the Division Educational Policy of the Dutch Association for Educational Research (VOR). His main research lines are sociology of education and educational policy, and the analysis of new sources and new methodologies in the history of education. Recent book publications are: The Black Box of Schooling: A Cultural History of the Classroom
with Ian Grosvenor and María del Mar del Pozo Andrés) and A History of Popular Education: Educating the People of the World

title: Dekker is Honorary Professor of History and Theory of Education at the University of Groningen. He was visiting professor at the European University Institute (Florence), Columbia University, the University of Sassari, and visiting Fellow at the Max Planck Institute for Human Development (Berlin). A former President and Honorary Life Member of ISCHE and BENGOO, he is Editor of Paedagogica Historica and member of the Editorial Board of History of Education, Historia y Memoria de la Educación, and Annali di storia dell’Educazione e delle Istituzioni Educative Education. His publications deal with long-term history of education, childhood, and children at risk. Recent publications are: A Cultural History of Education in the Renaissance
In Search of Multiple Compatibility: Modernization, Secularization, Religion, and Education in History”

container-title: She serves on the editorial board of academic journal Acta Paedagogica Vilnensia (Lithuania), as well as in the international advisory board of Paedagogica Historica. She is currently Link Convenor for Network 17, Histories of Education, European Education Research Association (EERA). Recent publications include: Kestere, Iveta and Irena Stonkuviene. “From National to Global? Research on the History of Education in the Baltic States (1990–2015): Examining Doctoral Theses.” Histoire de l’Education
note: Kestere, Iveta, Irena Stonkuviene and Zanda Rubene. “The New Soviet Man with a Female Body: Mother, Teacher, Tractor Driver . . . ”
title: Iveta Kestere is Professor at the Faculty of Education, Psychology and Art, University of Latvia. Her current research projects focus on the creation and training of the ‘New Soviet Man’ (in collaboration with the University of Vilnius, Lithuania), visual propaganda in education under European totalitarian regimes (in collaboration with the University of Vic, Spain), and childhood representations in Latvian museums (Latvian Council of Science). Her other research work concerns the history of educational sciences and the history of teacher training. She is the author of numerous international publications and the author and coeditor of nine books, such as the collected volume (co-edited with Ene-Silvia Sarv and Irena Stonkuviene) Pedagogy and Educational Sciences in the Post-Soviet Baltic States, 1990–2004: Changes and Challenges
